Latest News 

The Chief Monitor of the SMM to Ukraine, Ambassador Ertugrul Apakan, condemned the shelling in Mariupol on 24 January as a reckless, indiscriminate and disgraceful attack on innocent civilians.



The SMM released a Spot report on the shelling incident on Olimpiiska Street in Mariupol.

Read it at:

www.osce.org/ukraine-smm/136061 

SMM staff carried out crater analysis and reported on their findings following the shelling incidents in Mariupol and Donetsk (30 January) 

The SMM experiences difficulties with freedom of movement in the eastern Ukraine due to security concerns and increased problems in passing through the checkpoints.



The SMM continues to expand—the total number of International Monitors is 412, with 226 Monitors in Donetsk and Luhansk regions.
